page.title: 12HARTWELL HOUSE
page.content: Hartwell House is an example of a remodelled 17th century plan. The house was built in the shape of an H about 105ft. long. In the 18th century part of it was rebuilt. In the grounds of the house is Hartwell Church which is not used any more. It was built in 1756 of stone, wood, glass and lead. The lead was stolen from the roof and the interior was vandalised during World War 2 . The Hall in The House has a large fire place and is decorated with plaster panels. It has an oak staircase 8ft wide. A chimney piece has the date 1658 on it.
